Wikipedijinim člankom dodali digitalni predogled knjižnih virov

05 Nov 2019, 14:00


Internetna storitev za spletno branje digitalnih knjig uvaja pobudo za lajšanje preverb citatov v Wikipediji, največji spletni enciklopediji.

To naj bi dosegli z dodajanjem digitalnega posnetka točno določene strani v citat. Ko je pregled knjige na voljo, to olajša preverjanje resničnosti, ali vir dejansko govori o tem, kar je napisano v določenem članku na Wikipediji.
Medtem ko je bilo takšno preverjanje vedno mogoče, če smo v roke vzeli fizični izvod knjige, pa ni praktično za študente ali novinarje s kratkim rokom za oddajo svojega dela. Do težav pride tudi pri virih, ki so redki in težko dostopni. Nova pobuda teoretično pomeni, da je preverba vira le en klik stran.
V praksi pa bo trajalo kar nekaj časa, preden se bodo milijoni citatov na Wikipediji dejansko ujemali z ustreznimi viri (knjigami). Internetni arhiv je do zdaj povezal razmeroma majhen zbir 130.000 citatov s 50.000 knjigami. Velikopotezni načrti se zanašajo tudi na avtorje člankov na Wikipediji, ki citirajo vire v pravilni obliki. Tako morajo točno določiti številko strani v viru, da bo sistem sploh deloval. Številke ISBN so sicer zelo koristne pri iskanju ujemanj, vendar omenjene številka vsaka knjiga pač nima.
Storitev Internetni arhiv je naredila pomemben korak pri digitalizaciji knjig in drugih tiskanih virov. Viri poročajo, da imajo v bazi že več kot 3,8 milijona skeniranih knjig, vsak dan v bazo dodajo približno 10.000 novih. Pri “Arhivu” pravijo, da želijo v prihodnjih letih preseči številko 4 milijone digitaliziranih knjig.
Digitalizacija citatov knjig na Wikipediji je le del poskusov Spletnega arhiva, da bi natančne informacije olajšale iskanje v mdmrežju. Poleg dela na citatih knjig so aktivni tudi pri izboljšanju citatov v največji spletni encikloplediji. Kot poročajo, naj bi od začetka oktobra InternetArchiveBot popravil skoraj 6 milijonov napačno podanih citatov po Wikipediji.

Added a digital preview of book resources to Wikipedia articles

05 Nov 2019, 14:00


An online digital book reader service is launching an initiative to facilitate citation verification in Wikipedia, the largest online encyclopedia.

This should be achieved by adding a digital recording of a specific page to the quote. When a book review is available, this makes it easier to verify that the source is actually talking about what is written in a particular Wikipedia article.
While it was always possible to take a physical copy of a book, it is not practical for students or journalists with a short deadline to submit their work. There are also problems with resources that are scarce and difficult to access. The new initiative theoretically means that checking the feed is just a click away.
In practice, however, it will take some time before millions of citations on Wikipedia actually match the relevant sources (books). So far, the Internet Archive has linked a relatively small collection of 130,000 citations to 50,000 books. Ambitious plans also rely on the authors of Wikipedia articles citing sources in the correct format. So they need to pinpoint the page number in the feed for the system to work at all. Although ISBNs are very helpful in finding matches, each book does not have the number mentioned.
The Internet Archive service has taken a significant step in digitizing books and other print sources. Sources say they already have more than 3.8 million scanned books in the database, adding about 10,000 new ones to the database every day. Archives say they want to surpass 4 million digitized books in the coming years.
Digitizing book quotes on Wikipedia is only part of the attempts of the Web Archive to make accurate information easier to find on the Internet. In addition to working on book quotes, they are also active in improving citations in the largest online encyclopedia. As of early October, InternetArchiveBot is reported to have corrected nearly 6 million misquoted citations across Wikipedia.
